get.description:
This endpoint allows you to list clients and filter them by various values. The filters work in an "AND" fashion, so client must match all the requested filters in order to be returned, unless explicitly asked for via the `clientIds` parameter.

If more results match than what the endpoint is set to return, a URL to the next page of results will be provided in the response.

By default, client SSNs are excluded from the response unless both a) the token has permission to view sensitive client data and b) the SSN field was requested in the request via the `requestedSensitiveFields` parameter.

residentialAddress.description: If specified, must provide the entire `residentialAddress` object.

classes.description: Use code or label, both are optional but should provide one of them

referredBy.description: Type is required. Use id or name, both are optional but should provide one of them

preferredCaregiver.description: Caregiver ID or Name in `FirstName LastName` format

billingAddress.description: If specified, must provide the entire `billingAddress` object.

post.description: This endpoint allows you to add new clients to AxisCare. The minimum required information is a first name and last name, and a new client will be created with an Active status.

parameters.name: X-AxisCare-Api-Version
parameters.description: API version

parameters.name: clientId
parameters.description: Client ID

This endpoint returns a single client.

By default, client SSNs are excluded from the response unless both a) the token has permission to view sensitive client data and b) the SSN field was requested in the request via the `requestedSensitiveFields` parameter.

parameters.description: Comma-delimited string of names of sensitive fields to include in the payload

billingAddress.description: If specified, must provide the entire `billingAddress` object.

get.description:
This endpoint allows you to list caregivers and filter them by various values. The filters work in an
"AND" fashion, so caregivers must match all the requested filters in order to be returned, unless
explicitly asked for via the `caregiverIds` parameter.

If more results match than what the endpoint is set to return, a URL to the next page of results
will be provided in the response.

By default, caregiver SSNs are excluded from the response unless both a) the token has permission
to view sensitive client data and b) the SSN field was requested in the request via the
`requestedSensitiveFields` parameter.

In the case that some caregivers are not found by ID, there is a property called `caregiversNotFound` that contains an array of the not found IDs.

patch.description: This endpoint allows you to edit caregivers in AxisCare. You can supply a partial payload of only the keys you want to update.

classes.description:
When set on an update, specify the entire set of classes that should be associated with a caregiver.

If a full class object can't be supplied, either a `code` or `label` can be supplied and the corresponding class will be associated.

mailingAddress.description: If specified, must provide the entire `mailingAddress` object.

referredBy.description: Type is required. Use id or name, both are optional but should provide one of them

get.description:
This endpoint returns a single caregiver.

By default, caregiver SSNs are excluded from the response unless both a) the token has permission to view sensitive client data and b) the SSN field was requested in the request via the `requestedSensitiveFields` parameter.

parameters.description: API Version

parameters.name: clientIds
parameters.description: Comma-delimited string of client IDs to filter visit result set

parameters.description: Comma-delimited string of client class codes to filter visit result set

parameters.description: Comma-delimited string of client region IDs to filter visit result set

parameters.name: regionNames
parameters.description: Comma-delimited string of client region names to filter visit result set

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: Visit start date localized to visit timezone. Required if updatedSinceDate is not used

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: Visit end date localized to visit timezone. Required if updatedSinceDate is not used

parameters.name: clientAdminUsernames
parameters.description: Comma-delimited string of client administrator usernames to filter visit result set

parameters.name: verified
parameters.description: Verification status of visits, all visits returned by default

parameters.name: updatedSinceDate
parameters.description: UTC date to return visits which have been updated since said date

parameters.name: visitIds
parameters.description: Comma-delimited string of visit IDs to filter visit result set. If this filter is provided, then no other filters can be used.

get.description:
This endpoint allows you to list visits and filter them by various values. The filters work in an "AND" fashion, so the visit must match all the requested filters in order to be returned.

If more results match than what the endpoint is set to return, a URL to the next page of results will be provided in the response.

500.description:
Internal Server Error

If attempting to to add a `chargeRate` and change the `billableRateMode`, and custom bill rate adjustments have not been enabled, you will get an error.

post.description:
"This endpoint allows you to add a visit. The minimum required information is a client ID, a visit date, a start time, and an end time. You may specify *either* a service code *or* a description, but not both.  It also supports a custom billable rate property that you add to the request body:

`"billableRateMode": "custom"`.  

When using the custom billable mode, you will need to provide a `chargeRate`:

`"chargeRate": 120.45`

parameters.name: X-AxisCare-Api-Version
parameters.description: API version

500.description:
Internal Server Error

If attempting to to add a `chargeRate` and change the `billableRateMode`, and custom bill rate adjustments have not been enabled, you will get an error.

patch.description:
This endpoint allows you to modify an existing visit by its ID (e.g. `s=222:d=2024-03-04`). You can supply a partial payload of only the keys you want to update. You may specify *either* a service code *or* a description, but not both.  It also supports a custom billable rate property that you add to the request body:

`"billableRateMode": "custom"`.  

When using the custom billable mode, you will need to provide a `chargeRate`:

`"chargeRate": 120.45`

parameters.name: X-AxisCare-Api-Version
parameters.description: API version

get.description:
This endpoint returns a single applicant.

By default, applicant SSNs are excluded from the response unless both a) the token has permission to view sensitive client data and b) the SSN field was requested in the request via the `requestedSensitiveFields` parameter.

get.description:
This endpoint allows you to list applicants and filter them by various values. The filters work in an
"AND" fashion, so applicants must match all the requested filters in order to be returned, unless
explicitly asked for via the `applicantIds` parameter.

If more results match than what the endpoint is set to return, a URL to the next page of results
will be provided in the response.

By default, caregiver SSNs are excluded from the response unless both a) the token has permission
to view sensitive client data and b) the SSN field was requested in the request via the
`requestedSensitiveFields` parameter.

In the case that some applicants are not found by ID, there is a property called `applicantsNotFound` that contains an array of the not found IDs.
